**Red dragon scale mail** is a type of [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is made of [dragon hide](/wiki/Dragon_hide "Dragon hide") like all [dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 NetHack: The Next Generation](#NetHack:_The_Next_Generation)
  - [5.2 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.3 SporkHack](#SporkHack)
  - [5.4 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.5 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.6 FIQHack](#FIQHack)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Red dragon scale mail is not randomly generated. Reading a non-cursed [scroll of enchant armor](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_armor "Scroll of enchant armor") that targets worn [red dragon scales](/wiki/Red_dragon_scales "Red dragon scales") will convert them into mail, with a blessed scroll adding a point of [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment").

[Player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") that are not [monks](/wiki/Monk_\(player_monster\) "Monk (player monster)") generated on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane") have a 1⁄9 chance of [generating with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") red dragon scale mail as their initial body armor before role-specific replacements.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Description

While worn, red dragon scale mail confers 9 base AC and [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"). Uncontrolled [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") while wearing red dragon scale mail will revert them to scales and turn the wearer into a [red dragon](/wiki/Red_dragon "Red dragon").[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 9942b65d](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/9942b65df78dd55a7806ec), extrinsic sources of an elemental resistance now has a 99⁄100 chance of protecting your inventory from that type of damage. Per [commit ef1eeed7](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/ef1eeed7550e38fa1e4ff0ef608f3c8b55eaa950), both the scales and scale mail also provide [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").

## Strategy

- *Main article: [Dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail")*

Red dragon scale mail is rarely used by most characters, since [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") is sufficient enough to protect a character against many forms of [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire") damage, and some other sources of fire are more easily avoidable. It is also likely that you will obtain fire resistance from another source before fire attacks become a serious problem.

[Foodless](/wiki/Foodless "Foodless") [atheist](/wiki/Atheist "Atheist") characters may consider red dragon scale mail as an option to protect against the [fire traps](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap") in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom") - while it can be superseded by the [ring of fire resistance](/wiki/Ring_of_fire_resistance "Ring of fire resistance"), the ring must generally be identified in some way first.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Red dragon scale mail is more likely to be considered for some characters since it confers extrinsic fire resistance: they gain a valuable source of fire damage protection for their inventory, especially against revamped [flaming spheres](/wiki/Flaming_sphere "Flaming sphere"), while [humans](/wiki/Human_\(starting_race\) "Human (starting race)") are finally given a means to access infravision outside of polymorph. It may see slightly less early game consideration compared to other colors, due in some part to the [dwarvish cloak](/wiki/Dwarvish_cloak "Dwarvish cloak") - per [commit b98a70e3](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/b98a70e3ecaa4cbb5eb18c99de61cf84a2b52213), dwarvish cloaks protect against inventory damage from fire and cold 9⁄10 of the time.

## History

Red dragon scale mail first appears with most other colors of dragon scale mail in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"). From NetHack 3.0.0 to [NetHack 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.10 "NetHack 3.0.10"), including variants based on those versions, red dragon scale mail is created by polymorphing the corpse of a red dragon. Red dragon scales are introduced in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0"), along with the current method for converting them into dragon scale mail.

## Variants

- *Main article: [Dragon-scaled armor](/wiki/Dragon-scaled_armor "Dragon-scaled armor")*

In some variants, dragon scale mail is phased out in favor of dragon-scaled armor, whose implementation is based on a proposal by dtsund. Instead of being made into mail of its own, dragon scales are treated as a [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak"), and reading a scroll of enchant armor melds them onto a worn set of body armor, generally augmenting that armor by adding its AC and conferred extrinsic properties to it. Dragon-scaled armor is implemented in [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

Several variants also give red dragon scale mail additional properties while worn, and may even introduce other forms of red dragon scale armor. Variants that implement partial intrinsics and/or [object properties](/wiki/Object_properties "Object properties") may also make red dragon mail and other colors more worthwhile.

### NetHack: The Next Generation

[NetHack: The Next Generation](/wiki/NetHack:_The_Next_Generation "NetHack: The Next Generation") adds the [Scales of the Dragon Lord](/index.php?title=Scales_of_the_Dragon_Lord\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Scales of the Dragon Lord (page does not exist)"), a chaotic aritfact set of red dragon scale mail that is dropped by the [Dragon Lord](/index.php?title=Dragon_Lord\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Dragon Lord (page does not exist)") upon death, and can be [invoked](/wiki/Invoked "Invoked") for a dragon [breath](/wiki/Breath "Breath") attack.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [gnoll shamans](/wiki/Gnoll_shaman "Gnoll shaman") have an effective 9⁄50 chance of generating with red dragon scale mail.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), worn red dragon scale mail additionally confers a +1d6 damage bonus to melee attacks.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), dragon scales and dragon scale mail have randomized powers and [appearances](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") in each game - to [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for dragon armor or scales by its corresponding power, either type of armor must be formally identified first, e.g. by using a [scroll of identify](/wiki/Scroll_of_identify "Scroll of identify") on dropped dragon scales (which identifies the matching scale mail along with it) or by witnessing the dragon use its breath weapon. Only wishes from a [wand of wishing](/wiki/Wand_of_wishing "Wand of wishing") can create dragon scale mail directly.

Red dragon scale mail is effectively replaced by **fire dragon scale mail**, which confers only 5 base AC like all dragon scale mail in UnNetHack.

### dNetHack

- *Main article: [Dragon armor (dNetHack)](/wiki/Dragon_armor_\(dNetHack\) "Dragon armor (dNetHack)")*

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), worn red dragon scale mail additionally confers [flight](/wiki/Flight "Flight") and protection from [sliming](/wiki/Sliming "Sliming").

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), worn red dragon scale mail additionally confers [warning](/wiki/Warning "Warning"), infravision and [see invisible](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible"). It also weighs 300 aum like all dragon scale mail in FIQHack (which is halved while worn).

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 156](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mplayer.c#L156): *initial body armor for Astral playermons is random DSM, with equal probability*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/polyself.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 501](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/polyself.c#L501)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/polyself.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 518](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/polyself.c#L518)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [makemon.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 723](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/makemon.c#line723 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/makemon.c")
